article.headline: Duquesne 85, St. Bonaventure 78
article.story: OLEAN, N.Y. (AP) -- Elijah Palmer had 21 points and eight rebounds to lead Duquesne to a 85-78 victory over St. Bonaventure on Sunday. The Dukes (9-10, 4-4 Atlantic 10) outrebounded the Bonnies 47-32 as they snapped a two-game losing streak. St. Bonaventure (6-12, 2-5) lost its third straight. Maurice Young had 16 points as St. Bonaventure took a 37-36 halftime lead. Young finished with 23 points and seven rebounds. The Dukes opened the second half with a 19-9 run to take a seven-point lead with 13 minutes left. St. Bonaventure came within four points with 1:13 left when Young hit a 3-pointer, but could get no closer. Palmer scored seven points in the final minute. Ron Dokes had 18 points and 13 rebounds and Jack Higgins had 14 points and six rebounds for the Dukes. Ahmad Smith added 18 points for the Bonnies, while Marques Green had nine points on 3-of-20 shooting and eight assists.
